content.question: For time t>0 , the position of a particle moving in the xy-plane is given by the parametric equations <math> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>4</mn> <mi>t</mi> <mo>+</mo> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </math> and <math> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> <mi>t</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </math>. What is the acceleration vector of the particle at time t=1 ?

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.6: (BC ONLY) Solving Motion Problems Using Parametric and Vector-Valued Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
